intro: Cucullaria ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are usually pink to purplish in color. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that splits open to release the seeds.
